text: 1 minute review.
speaker: A

text: Dead space three ready?
speaker: A

text: Go.
speaker: A

text: It's kind of good.
speaker: A

text: Forget about the demo for a second.
speaker: A

text: It still has plenty of tense moments inside of their electric ships with stuff jumping out of vents, but it certainly has a definite greater focus on action because of this.
speaker: A

text: You end up with way too much ammo with way too much help, making the whole game insultingly easy.
speaker: A

text: There are still puzzles sprinkle throughout the whole game, and those are pretty decent.
speaker: A

text: There are still a few great Dead Space style set pieces, but those are punctuated by really stupid action moments.
speaker: A

text: There is a lack of creativity in the enemy types.
speaker: A

text: There's a lot of repeat enemies from the first two games, and not much else beyond that.
speaker: A

text: The ability to dodge roll is a much welcome addition.
speaker: A

text: However, the COVID mechanic is absolutely worthless.
speaker: A

text: There's no point to having this in the game.
speaker: A

text: I like that exploration is worthwhile going off the objective pass does yield some pretty good rewards.
speaker: A

text: The Coop mode is enjoyable.
speaker: A

text: It doesn't really ruin the experience at all, but it's only really enjoyable if you played on higher difficulties.
speaker: A

text: You do get good value for your money because there's lots of replayability.
speaker: A

text: There are several different game modes that you can unlock.
speaker: A

text: It ends up being a decent horror game that gets watered down too much by action and trying to go for mass appeal.
speaker: A

text: It certainly isn't as good as Dead Space One or two.
speaker: A

text: Dead Space Three gets a seven out of ten.
speaker: A
